before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"dpng7","text":"Most updates to existing NCBI submissions are performed through email requests to each respective NCBI database (e.g. BioSample, BioProject, Sequence Read Archive, and Pathogen Detection). NCBI curators within each respective database expect these emails to update and retract data. It is their job to help the data stay current, so do not hesitate to correct errors when they are spotted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"41p3a","text":"PURPOSE: After data are submitted to NCBI submitters often encounter the need to update, retract, or replace these records. This is called data curation. This protocol provides instructions for keeping these records up-to-date for each relevant database at NCBI. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8um9u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3r0um","text":"SCOPE: This protocol covers curation for the following NCBI databases:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fq371","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dk08v","text":"BioProject","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qrbt","text":"BioSample","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"emppa","text":"Sequence Read Archive","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5j6j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bt785","text":"Version history:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2svco","text":"V2. Edit submissions using the NCBI portal (Manage data). Moved \"how to find my data\" content to a new protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"auchf","text":"V3: Update to BioSample section, providing further guidance on updating taxonomic names. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"535bk","text":"V4: Clarifying protocol for SRA retraction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"a7upn","text":"This method is under development and assessment for suitability of use. It is likely that modifications will be made to improve the method.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation: Timme, R.E., Wolfgang, W.J., Balkey, M. et al. Optimizing open data to support one health: best practices to ensure interoperability of genomic data from bacterial pathogens. One Health Outlook 2, 20 (2020). https://doi.org/10.1186/s42522-020-00026-3. Timme R.E., Sanchez Leon M., Allard M.W. (2019) Utilizing the Public GenomeTrakr Database for Foodborne Pathogen Traceback. In: Bridier A. (eds) Foodborne Bacterial Pathogens. Methods in Molecular Biology, vol 1918. Humana, New York, NY. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-1-4939-9000-9_17

{"blocks":[{"key":"brhbn","text":"Email for BioProject database: bioprojecthelp@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":62}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":31,"length":31}],"data":{}},{"key":"1vip0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3e8fr","text":"Use this email for the following tasks, include the BioProject accession in the email subject:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86fds","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9n43k","text":"Questions about errors or processing of a BioProject submission","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amave","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4aemt","text":"Convert a Data BioProject to an Umbrella BioProject ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vtm2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1666v","text":"Re-assign a BioProject from one Umbrella BioProject to another","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E2F5A4C0C28D11EDB9BB7700B9F0C0F3","url":"mailto:bioprojecthelp@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4rmet","text":"All edits or updates to BioSample records are submitted via email to the BioSample database: biosamplehelp@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":72,"length":52},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":93,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":93,"length":30}],"data":[]},{"key":"7rh57","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eojk7","text":"Use this email for the following tasks. Include your lab and the request date in your subject line for easy tracking, eg “FDA BioSample update, Dec 10, 2019”.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7733t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bhs98","text":"Questions about validation errors or processing of a BioSample submission.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dl0ks","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"at481","text":"Update, correct, or add fields/attributes to a BioSample(s)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8dkao","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6k6ak","text":"Retraction","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fvold","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3er64","text":"Add a linkage or re-assign linkage to a BioProject","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4s6n9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"drqk9","text":"Add or change a strain or isolate field to an existing biosample where one has been lacking (necessary for the isolate's assembly to appear in GenBank).  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":16,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":26,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5m6uo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c8u1v","text":"Taxonomic updates: Include \"pd-help@ncbi.hlm.nih.gov\" on these requests to ensure taxonomic changes get propagated fully across NCBI databases. The organism name should include the Genus species, subspecies where present, plus serovar/serotype information. In cases where the BioSample attributes serovar/serotype were populated (e.g. with traditional serotyping results), ensure they are also updated as needed. Special note about Salmonella enterica isolates: please submit or update serotyping information in the serovar field, not the serotype field.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":24},{"style":"bold","offset":516,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":539,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":432,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":28,"length":24}],"data":[]},{"key":"8nqct","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"98qd3","text":"You will receive a confirmation email that the updates were performed. These types of transactions are common for this database, so do not hesitate to submit requests as needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"F76E5C9502084763BD1BFEFCC2A9898B","url":"mailto:biosamplehelp@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CDF10BC37B1311EDA2620A58A9FEAC02","url":"mailto:pd-help@ncbi.hlm.nih.gov"}}}}
